answers.answer: No,not at all.That instrument would have been sterile.
No you did not have an exposure.

Thanks for your reply RainLover71.I'm sorry about my english,I'm a doctor,I mean that I share the stethoscope with my collugue.This stethoscope  ear plugs were broken and scratched my collegue's external auditory canal.About one minute later I use this stethoscope and it also scratched me.

HIV is unable to reproduce outside its living host (unlike many bacteria or fungi, which may do so under suitable conditions), except under laboratory conditions; therefore, it does not spread or maintain infectiousness outside its host.HIV is transmitted by;Unprotected penetrative anal and/or vaginal sexSharing works with other IV drug usersMother to child

Thanks for your replyTeak!I'm sorry about my english.Let me give you the details.I'm a doctor,I share the stethoscope with my collugue.This stethoscope  ear plugs were broken and scratched my collegue's external auditory canal.About one minute later I use this stethoscope and it also scratched me.Just a little blood.I'm worried about if  my collegue is a HIV patient,can i get infected?
NO.. You don't have to repeat the question we understand English every well.
I'm really appreciate your help and humor~
You're welcome
Dear doctor.Do you agree with Teak?a little blood will soon inactive and can't infect me?Stethoscope scraped my collegue and one minute later which scraped me.Thanks.
Yes I agree with my fellow expert
There are no Experts on this fourm.
Maybe you aren't a expert,but the information you provide is accuracy and enough for me to assess whether I have a exposure.
there are no drs on this forum and THE ONLY person here, who could even be considered close to being an expert in this field is TEAK.  he knows and lives HIV ! ! !

I read his "About me",I think he is a warrior in this world.In my country HIV just like a devil and people who be infected are regard as zombie.So everybody is frightened of it.The patient hide their disease and even suicide.
Thats because most of them aren't taking ARVs
People hide there HIV status here also.
People in my country ARVs is free.Country afford this fee.But this disease can't be cured now.That's why everybody scared and often regard this disease as a dirty disease(like STD) in my country.
It is no different to diabetes really,it can be managed now.I agree though that there still is a stigma.
Big difference with HIV you don't have your limbs removed and you don't get ganggrene. Which you wouldn't really know you don't have either.
hiv...even with meds...is NO walk in the park ! ! !

question: Today, a colleague used a stethoscope, after one minute later, I  use this stethoscope.Unfortunately, this stethoscope ear plugs are damaged, scratched me and my colleagues in the external auditory canal,a little bit of blood.Do I have a risk?Thanks.
title: DO I have a risk?
